source.7cabd8cd: ### Let's analyse the top 5 countries and their top 5 players!
source.0676595d:
one who have watched this unprecedented run wonder if the younger players are weaker than usual. 
More likely, three all-time-great champions — Federer, Nadal and Djokovic — have randomly risen up in the same era. 
They’re likely to be motivated by their rivals’ achievements, using the others’ wins as inspiration to improve their tactics.

But don’t be too surprised if this continues for a while, even another year, as long as Federer, Nadal and Djokovic remain healthy. Djokovic, who has won the Australian Open six times, will be the favorite there in January, and Nadal might well be in shape for his 14th French Open title. That would bring this wild period of 30s dominance to 11 straight majors. But whatever happens, the chance of any generation matching this accomplishment in the future is slim perhaps kind of impossible!
source.0dc9d37c:
### | “The Big 3 are not chasing history, they are just chasing each other”
Vijay Amritraj said this in an interview post corona virus lockdown which actually changed the way we watch sports these days, with all the empty stadiums to all the fake audience voices — we have come to a very dark place at the moment! I’ve been a huge tennis fan since the last decade or so, recently getting into data science has made me love tennis even more! I’ve been experimenting my so called “data skills” which I have acquired in these last 6 months on this beautiful sport “Tennis” kind of helping me understand the sport as well as the whole “data science” picture as I’ve been studying this subject and implementing it on something which is soo close to my heart gives me another aspect of looking at things which I actually wasn’t really able to while practicing my skills!
source.90c23fbf:
#### Introduction:

So, this analysis is basically a country wise analysis of tennis data set which is publicly available on GitHub.
The huge 20 years dataset prepared by Jeff Sackmann contains information on every single match played since 2000. with details on every match’s date, location, tournament type, surface, winner and loser, games/sets played, duration and additional statistics such as players’ rankings, players’ age and height, aces, double faults, break points faced and saved, service points among other helpful stats for both players of the match.

source.0ca852ed:
...
This is my first Tableau Representation and an article, i think will help people getting into this on their own, this will basically cover the basic Jupyter EDA and Visualizations.
the basic goal of the analysis is to check out which part of the world is following the tennis world better and obviously looking at the big three which cannot actually be ignored if we talk about this sport!
source.6b732e9f:
- “Roger Federer”
- “Novak Djokovic”
- “Rafael Nadal”

and to see how amazingly well they have dominated the whole sport for the last 2 DECADES, but first let’s do some basic EDA about the top countries as well as their top player first!
source.d4be1b31: Even more so, they’ve gone on streaks of 18 and 11 straight wins without an outsider winning one (in 2005–2009 and 2010–2012), not to mention a current streak of 13.
source.a39f2087:
#### Top 5 Countries with the most tennis wins are:
1. Spain
2. France
3. USA
4. Argentina
5. Switzerland
source.a972f3e5: #### As we have all the separate 20 years worth of data, we will have to load it in a single dataframe by using the “pd.concat” function which will combine all of these in 1:
source.b830dd02: To round out the 3, Novak Djokovic collected 17 major championships over a dominating span of fewer than 11 years. To top it all off, the Big 3 have collected 56 of the 67 major championships held since Federer’s first title in 2003.
source.708a28bd:
#### It’s been 20 years of pure dominance by the Big 3.
Roger Federer, the record-holder for ATP Major Championships won and resident tennis maestro, leads the 3 with 20 major championships, including 8 Wimbledon Championships. Rafael Nadal, the undisputed King of Clay, holds 12 French Open Championships and 19 major wins overall.
